item.title: Clint the Stranger
item.description: Clint the Stranger, also known as Clint the Nevada's Loner, Nevada Clint and Clint, the Lonely Nevadan, is a 1967 Italian spaghetti western starring George Martin. A sequel entitled The Return of Clint the Stranger would follow in 1972.

item.title: Hate Thy Neighbor
item.description: Hate Thy Neighbor is a 1968 Italian Spaghetti Western film written and directed by Ferdinando Baldi.

item.title: The Belle Starr Story
item.description: The Belle Starr Story/Il mio corpo per un poker is a 1968 Italian made episodic Bonnie and Clyde type spaghetti western co-written and co-directed by Lina Wertmüller and starring Elsa Martinelli who also sings the title song. It is the only spaghetti western directed by a woman and one of the few which stars a woman in the title role. Wertmüller replaced after a few days Piero Cristofani, who was at his directorial debut.

item.title: Oklahoma John
item.description: Oklahoma John also known as Ranch of the Ruthless or The Man from Oklahoma is a Spanish, German and 1965 Italian international co-production western film directed by Jaime Jesús Balcázar and Roberto Bianchi Montero.

item.title: Il momento di uccidere
item.description: The Moment To Kill is a 1968 Italian spaghetti western film.

item.title: The Mercenary
item.description: The Mercenary, known in the UK as A Professional Gun, is a 1968 Zapata Western film directed by Sergio Corbucci. The film stars Franco Nero, Jack Palance, Tony Musante, Eduardo Fajardo and Giovanna Ralli, and features a musical score by Ennio Morricone and Bruno Nicolai.

item.title: A Man Called Sledge
item.description: A Man Called Sledge is a 1970 Italian spaghetti western film starring James Garner in an extremely offbeat role as a grimly evil thief, and featuring Dennis Weaver, Claude Akins and Wayde Preston. The film was written by Vic Morrow and Frank Kowalski, and directed by Morrow in Techniscope.

item.title: I Want Him Dead
item.description: I Want Him Dead is a 1968 Italian-Spanish Spaghetti Western film directed by Paolo Bianchini and starring Craig Hill.

item.title: Tal der Hoffnung
item.description: Tal der Hoffnung ist ein Italowestern von Alfonso Balcázar aus dem Jahr 1967.

item.title: Hasse deinen Nächsten
item.description: Hasse deinen Nächsten ist ein Italowestern aus dem Jahr 1968, den Ferdinando Baldi inszenierte. Im deutschen Sprachraum wurde der Film 2005 erstmals im Privatfernsehen gezeigt und später auf DVD veröffentlicht.
